name: Auto-quicken caster Druid - Druid 33 / CoT 6 / Ranger 1
author: TheSquid

posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
This is a DC caster Druid build with Automatic Quicken Spell 3. It is made for environments where perma-Haste is hard to obtain and summons/animal companions scale decently into epics (e.g. the World of Greyhawk PW server).

It is strong because Druids are strong, but it is more an academic exercise than a build I would recommend playing. If you want to play a caster Druid with AQ3 (which I still think is a good idea!), just drop 4 Great Wisdoms from the Hierophant of the Cabal.

Features:
  • Maximum DC on Conjuration spells
  • Automatic Quicken Spell 3
  • 37 spell penetration, which is the highest one can get given the two above
  • Many spells/day
  • One meta-magic feat - I choose Maximize
  • Scribe Scrolls for extra slots
Bugs:
  • Awful AC and AB
  • The Druid spellbook is not very versatile, for instance there is no Breach effect. You will not be as powerful as a full Sorcerer, but such is life
  • If you run out of spells, or if you can’t break an enemy’s SR, you are in trouble

Comments:
I set out to make a Druid with AQ3, and this is the result. Unlike other casters, Druids don’t get the Haste spell (which is kind of essential for a mage, as it doubles your output). The amount of sacrifice you need to make to mimic it without spending 1/6th of your time chugging potions is very large, unless you are willing to play with a low caster level and a low spell penetration. This build achieves the maximum possible CL and SR constrained on having AQ3, 38 Wisdom, and ESF:Conjuration. The class spread cannot be touched at all to reach that, and there is no room for Dragon Shape (which would not benefit from being a Monk anyway).

Everything else can be changed according to preference: I choose Scribe Scroll and Maximize Spell as my two extra feats, as I find that the Druid spellbook is well suited to be Maxed. Scrolls I find vital: for those who don’t know, casting a spell from a scroll takes a full round, unless the caster is hasted (or quickened) and the scroll is cast as the second spell. In other words, with Haste on (or AQ), you can cast a spell from your spellbook and then a spell from a scroll every round, effectively doubling your slots. You have plenty of skillpoints to allocate as you like, and even starting stats can be customised at will.

To play as a caster, you need to survive in order to be able to cast your spells. Since you have no AC, you need summons and your companion to tank for you. This will not necessarily work in epic levels in vanilla NWN, but works alright in environments such as WoG where both have been buffed. Use Defensive Casting Mode to avoid attacks if you have to come in close (for eg Harm), and your crowd control spells to keep enemies at bay. And pray you don’t find a perma-Haste item, or all your sacrifices will be in vain and you’ll want to hit yourself in the head.

Overall, not as strong a build as the Hierophant of the Cabal or the SSD Arch-Druid, and lacking Monk AC, Evasion, and Dragon Shape. Seriously, if you want to play a caster Druid, choose one of those. If you want to give it AQ3, which is nice, just drop some GWIS and accept the loss of 2 spell DC.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It is an interesting build you have here #TheSquid for a class that does not have haste in the spell book and environments where perma-haste is unavailable.
Ranger (1) is a nice way to squeeze in that extra feat. 
How would the build work, I wonder, if you dropped Ranger and took Monk instead for better AC and monk attack schedule? If you drop two Great wisdom feats there could even be room for Dragon shape and make the build less dependent on summons and a so-so spell penetration. Or am I missing something obvious?

You are completely right, I agree that a class spread of Druid 32/33 - Monk 1/2 - CoT 6 (dropping 2 GWIS) or Druid 36/37 - Monk 1/2 - CoT 2 (dropping 4 GWIS) results in a better build. You only need the Ranger level to get absolute maximum spell DC while retaining a high caster level.
